alert.note: Alert for Baker County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 12:33PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Baker County through 115 PM PDT... At 1233 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sparta, or 28 miles northeast of Baker City, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Carson around 1250 PM PDT. Sparta around 100 PM PDT. Halfway and Richland around 110 PM PDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
